item.name: The Adventurers: The Temple of Chac
Age of Conan: The Strategy Board Game
Agricola
item.comment:
The best Euro game. Agricola had established its position in the top three and everybody was talking about it, so I just had to try it. It really lived up to the expectations. Can't figure out anything bad to say about it. What appeals me most:
-Very thematic for an Euro. -Amount of different options per turn. -Makes you want to play more and try something different. -Amount of different cards guarantees the re-playability.

item.name: Android
item.comment: Very good theme. Lots of cool stories and very different characters. If you like Blade Runner and Cyberpunk, this should fit you... however, couple of warnings are in place. First, even though separate mechanics are all pretty good, there are sooooo many of them that it is really difficult sometimes to get hang of the best strategies and tactics. Second, there isn't so much detective work in this one. I know this will bother many people who expects to find a murder mystery _solving_ game.

item.name: Android: Netrunner – A Study in Static
Arkham Horror: Curse of the Dark Pharaoh Expansion
BattleLore
item.comment: Streamlined and more modern version of the C&C series with high quality components and looooooooots of expansions (just as Memoir'44). I like this a bit less than Memoir'44, but just a bit... ;)

item.name: BattleLore: The Hundred Years' War – Crossbows & Polearms
Betrayal at House on the Hill
Blood Bowl: Team Manager – The Card Game
Blood Bowl: Team Manager – The Card Game – Foul Play
Blood Bowl: Team Manager – The Card Game – Sudden Death
Commands & Colors: Ancients
item.comment: Predecessor of the Memoir'44 (M44) and Battlelore (BL). Bit more complex and therefor bit more tactical options, but IMO Memoir and Battlelore deliver better overall experience because of the better quality components, but I can see why some people prefer this over M44 or BL.

item.name: Conflict of Heroes: Awakening the Bear! – Russia 1941-42
item.comment: This was long in my radar before I bought it. And I do like it. Very clever mechanics. Quality components. It describes this one very well that it is the only war game that my wife is willing to play... :)

item.name: Cosmic Encounter
item.comment: True classic. Lot of re-playability. Lot chaos as well. Sets a very clear and short set of rules and then all the powers and extras break and bend the rules over and over again and it's fun!! :)

item.name: Descent: Journeys in the Dark (Second Edition)
Dungeons & Dragons: The Fantasy Adventure Board Game
Escape: The Curse of the Temple
Felix: The Cat in the Sack
Flash Point: Fire Rescue – Urban Structures
Formula D: Circuits 2 – Hockenheim and Valencia
Formula Dé Circuits 23 - 26: USA Track Pack #1
Gears of War: The Board Game
Heroscape Master Set: Battle for the Underdark
Heroscape Master Set: Rise of the Valkyrie
The Hobbit: The Defeat of Smaug
Horus Heresy
item.comment:
In my opinion this game delivers in Warhammer universe the same experience as War of the Rings does in the Lord of the Rings universe.
Both have the same scale and are just filled with the theme. They both have also some nice and unique mechanics. Horus Heresy takes a little less time to play than War of the Ring which is a good thing for me, but on the other hand there is a little less battle than you might expect. So, I understand why some people can list that as problem.
I have never started collecting Warhammer armies but I have always been very interested in the storyline and the universe. For me this is the best way of playing in that universe.

item.name: Invasion from Outer Space: The Martian Game
King of Tokyo: Garfield's Gift Promo Card
Kreml
item.comment: This is one of my all-time favorites. I do own the original Fata Morgana version, but I would really really like to have the AH version!

item.name: Last Night on Earth: Growing Hunger
Last Night on Earth: The Zombie Game
The Lord of the Rings Trading Card Game
Lord of the Rings: Friends & Foes
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game
The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – Khazad-dûm
Lord of the Rings: The Confrontation
Mage Knight Board Game
item.comment:
The best Adventure RPG game. Deckbuilding in adventure/RPG setting with almost puzzle-like combat. Very clever mechanics that keep you thinking about "how I will play it next time" long after you stopped playing. Amazing!
Essen 2011

item.name: Memoir '44
item.comment: The best war game. Streamlined and more modern version of the C&C series with high quality components and looooooooots of expansions.

item.name: Memoir '44: Campaign Book Volume 1
item.comment: Finally some background story to glue together a series of fights with my all time favorite just light enough war game!

item.name: Middle-Earth Quest
item.comment: Very strong theme and well working interesting card-driven combat system. However downtime for hero players is a bit too much at least in 4 player game.

item.name: Monsters Menace America
item.comment: Cool bits. Very entertaining when in the right mood. If I would have to describe what Ameritrash games are with just one example game, I'd use this one.. Oh, and did I say cool bits already. They really are... :)

item.name: Neuroshima Hex! Duel Chain Reaction Cards
Ninja: Legend of the Scorpion Clan
Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Rise of the Runelords – Base Set
Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Rise of the Runelords – Character Add-On Deck
Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Rise of the Runelords – Fortress of the Stone Giants Adventure Deck 4
Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Rise of the Runelords – Sins of the Saviors Adventure Deck 5
Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Rise of the Runelords – Spires of Xin-Shalast Adventure Deck 6
Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Rise of the Runelords – The Hook Mountain Massacre Adventure Deck 3
Pathfinder Adventure Card Game: Rise of the Runelords – The Skinsaw Murders Adventure Deck 2
Pizza Box Football
item.comment:
The best sports game. I love American Football. It is my favourite sport. Ultimate team sport in which there is a lot of tactical scheming going on from the coaching side but in the end it's a matter of one guy winning the battle with another guy in front of him.
Pizza Box Football simulates this well. You get to be in the part of the coach scheming and planning, calling the plays. Dice the simulate how well your guys "win the battle with the guys in front of them".
It has a lot of dice rolling and in the beginning there is a lot of chart reading and it all can feel overwhelming. But when you get a hang of it, the whole "guessing your opponents next moves and trying to yours" comes into play. In the end it feels like you are the coach in the sidelines trying to outsmart the opponent and hoping your team executes according to your plans... at least for me it feels like this! :)
I have tried a lot of different american football games and this is by far the best!

item.name: Power Grid: Northern Europe/United Kingdom & Ireland
Race for the Galaxy
item.comment:
The best card game. I would not have been even interested in this if my friend had not made me play with him. After that single play I barely understood all the rules and I had absolutely no idea about why I lost with such a great margin. But it got me thinking about the game for rest of the evening and the next day... and then on the following day I bought it myself! :)
-Amazingly deep game when comparing to its length -Lot of different routes to winning -(I've heard that it) gives challenge for a long time - haven't played nearly as much as I would have wanted -Everyone that I have introduced this, have really liked it. -Theme is there behind all those clever mechanics

item.name: Race for the Galaxy: Rebel vs Imperium
item.comment: Excellent expansion for the best card game ever! :)

item.name: Race for the Galaxy: The Brink of War
item.comment: Excellent expansion for the best card game ever! :)

item.name: Race for the Galaxy: The Gathering Storm
item.comment: A very good expansion for the best card game ever! :)

item.name: Revolver Expansion 1.2: Hunt the Man Down
Robinson Crusoe: Adventures on the Cursed Island
Roll Through the Ages: The Bronze Age
Roll Through the Ages: The Late Bronze Age
Runebound (Second Edition)
item.comment: Just enough character development, very good combat mechanics, varying monsters and huge amount of expansions. I consider this a classic.

item.name: Runewars
item.comment: The best fantasy strategy game. Gives you grand scale strategy experience but with only 3hrs play time. Mechanics are very well designed.

item.name: Sid Meier's Civilization: The Board Game
Slide 5
item.comment: Very clever card game that keeps you thinking of tactics long after a game is played...

item.name: Small World: Grand Dames of Small World
Space Alert
item.comment:
I'm slowly turning into Vlaada fan! :)
-Very fun way of simulating chaos in the space -Good co-operation with different roles for everyone -Good mechanics combining real-time chaos and then step-by-step resolution. -Very challenging and you have to also develop good team dynamics to be successful ! -Did I say it already, it's FUNNY!! :)

item.name: Space Hulk: Death Angel – The Card Game
Space Hulk: Death Angel – The Card Game – Mission Pack 1

Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – Imperial Aces Expansion Pack
Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – Millennium Falcon Expansion Pack
Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – Slave I Expansion Pack

Star Wars: X-Wing Miniatures Game – TIE Phantom Expansion Pack

Summoner Wars: Guild Dwarves vs Cave Goblins
Summoner Wars: Hawk's Strike Reinforcement Pack
Summoner Wars: Jungle Elves Faction Deck
Summoner Wars: Phoenix Elves vs Tundra Orcs
Through the Ages: A Story of Civilization
Tide of Iron: Designer Series Vol. 1
War of the Ring (first edition)
item.comment:
The best movie/book based game. One of my all time favourites. This is really an Epic game from the Epic book(s). And every played game tells a story. This is best played every now and then without too much of analyzing of opening moves and best tactics and all that.
As with all of the 9's and 10's in my list, the theme is strong!

item.name: War of the Ring: Battles of the Third Age
War of the Ring: Lords of Middle-earth
